discussion.content: The number of ISLs required between Cisco MDS switches will depend on the desired end-to-end oversubscription ratio. The storage port oversubscription ratio from a single storage port to multiple servers can be used to help determine the number of ISLs needed for each edge-to-core connection.

questions.question_text: What influences the number of ISLs that are required between Cisco MDS Series switches?
Which type fields can an engineer use to identify an iSCSI participant? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C is correct. This policy map shows a wrong MTU config.
Check "12. Do I need to enable Jumbo frames for FCOE?" in
https://community.cisco.com/t5/data-center-documents/fibre-channel-over-ethernet-fcoe-questions-and-answers-from-live/ta-p/3108755

Selected Answer: C
2112 bytes (Fibre Channel payload) + 4 bytes (FCB header) + 2 bytes (FCop header) = 2158 bytes Answer is C.

Answer: C
The minimum MTU is 2158 bytes
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/qos/521_n1_1/b_5k_QoS_Config_521N11/b_5k_QoS_Config_521N11_chapter_0110.html

from link refer

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/qos/521_n1_1/b_5k_QoS_Config_521N11/b_5k_QoS_Config_521N11_chapter_0110.html

The FCoE system class (for Fibre Channel andFCoE traffic) has a default MTU of 2158 bytes. This value cannot be modified. 

so i think C is correct.

choices.B: Ethernet and unified ports on the same port channel

D is correct.

i think D.

comments.content: Why wouldn't a VPC be supported with FCoE? I'm not sure but I like the C answer better...

I agree with D. 
section "Supported Configurations" of link. 
VPC could be only on ethernet no unified and the corss connection with pinning is supported

questions.question_text: Which two configuration methods can be used to deploy QoS to Cisco MDS Series switches? (Choose two.)

choices.E: multiple QoS policies that match multiple devices
choices.B: multiple QoS policies that match individual devices
